channel.title: Shree Balaji Envirotech
channel.description: Premium Biomass Pellet Manufacturer in Punjab - Sustainable Energy Solutions for Industries

item.title: Home - Shree Balaji Envirotech
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Premium Biomass Pellet Solutions | Punjab

Leading manufacturer of eco-friendly biomass pellets in Punjab. Save 40% on fuel costs with our sustainable energy solutions. High-quality, carbon-neutral biomass fuel for industries.

Our Products

We manufacture three types of premium biomass pellets:

  • Rice Husk Pellets – 3800-4200 kcal/kg calorific value, ideal for cost-sensitive applications
  • Sawdust Pellets – 4200-4500 kcal/kg, premium quality for high-efficiency boilers
  • Agro-Waste Pellets – Made from mixed agricultural waste, balanced performance and cost

Manufacturing Process

Our state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Bathinda, Punjab follows a 6-step process:

  1. Raw Material Collection – Sourced from local farmers and agricultural waste
  2. Shredding & Drying – Reducing moisture to below 14%
  3. Grinding – Hammer mill processing for uniform particle size
  4. Pelletization – High-pressure compression using YULONG pellet mills
  5. Cooling & Screening – Quality control and grading
  6. Packaging & Delivery – Moisture-proof packaging with pan-Punjab delivery

Why Choose Biomass Pellets?

  • 25-40% cost savings compared to coal
  • Carbon-neutral, eco-friendly fuel
  • Low ash content (<5%)
  • High calorific value (4200+ kcal/kg)
  • Government subsidies & carbon credit eligibility
  • Consistent quality with BIS certification

Biomass vs Coal Comparison

ParameterBiomass PelletsCoal
Price per ton₹7,000-8,500₹10,000-12,000
Ash Content3-5%20-40%
Sulphur<0.05%2-4%
CO2 EmissionsCarbon NeutralHigh
Calorific Value4000-4500 kcal/kg5000-6000 kcal/kg

Industries We Serve

  • Textile Mills – Dyeing and finishing boilers
  • Brick Kilns – Coal replacement fuel
  • Rice Mills – Parboiling boiler fuel
  • Dairy Plants – Pasteurization steam
  • Paper Mills – Pulp processing energy
  • Food Processing – Steam and heating
  • Distilleries – Ethanol production fuel
  • Poultry Farms – Brooder heating

Savings Calculator

Industries switching from coal to biomass pellets save 25-40% on fuel costs. A factory consuming 100 tons of coal monthly saves Rs 1.4-3 lakhs per month.

Certifications

  • ISO 9001 – Quality Management
  • ISO 14001 – Environmental Management
  • BIS Certified Pellets
  • PPCB Green Category

Contact Us

Shree Balaji Envirotech
Near Grain Market, Bathinda, Punjab 151001
Phone: +91 62806 10158 | +91 83604 10158
Email: shreebalajienvirotech@gmail.com

item.title: About Us - Shree Balaji Envirotech
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Building a Greener Future Together

Shree Balaji Envirotech is Punjab's trusted partner in sustainable biomass solutions, driven by a passionate team committed to environmental protection and industrial growth.

Our Story

Shree Balaji Envirotech was born from a unique convergence of entrepreneurs from diverse business backgrounds who shared a common concern – the environmental crisis caused by stubble burning in Punjab and the rising fuel costs affecting industries.

Our founders, each successful in their respective fields, recognized that Punjab's agricultural waste could be transformed from a pollution problem into a sustainable energy solution. With expertise spanning agriculture, manufacturing, finance, and operations, they came together to establish a company that would bridge the gap between farmers with crop residue and industries seeking affordable, eco-friendly fuel.

Today, we stand as Punjab's premier biomass pellet manufacturer, processing thousands of tons of agricultural waste annually and helping industries reduce their carbon footprint while saving on fuel costs.

Our Team

Dhruv Singla – Founder & Managing Partner

Visionary leader with expertise in business development and sustainable energy solutions. Driving the company's mission to revolutionize the biomass industry in Punjab.

Keshav Goyal – Partner

Brings extensive experience in operations and supply chain management, ensuring seamless delivery of quality biomass products.

Davinder Kumar – Partner

Expert in industrial relations and client partnerships, building strong relationships with businesses across Punjab.

Vishnu Goyal – Partner

Specializes in financial planning and strategic growth, driving the company's expansion and profitability.

Umesh Gupta – Partner

Focuses on quality control and production excellence, maintaining the highest standards in biomass manufacturing.

Gurmeet Singh – Partner

Leads farmer outreach and raw material sourcing, creating sustainable partnerships with agricultural communities.

Our Mission

  • Growth of Business – Expanding sustainable energy solutions while creating value for our partners, clients, and communities.
  • Protect Nature – Committed to environmental conservation by promoting clean, renewable energy alternatives.
  • Reduce Pollution – Eliminating stubble burning and industrial emissions through eco-friendly biomass solutions.
  • Save Money – Helping industries cut fuel costs by 30-40% with affordable, high-quality biomass pellets.
  • Clear Field Waste – Transforming agricultural residue into valuable fuel, solving the stubble disposal problem for farmers.

Our Journey

  • June 2025 – Planning & Research: Comprehensive planning for property acquisition, budget allocation, ROI analysis, investment structuring, and all project parameters finalized.
  • November 2025 – Company Incorporation: Shree Balaji Envirotech officially incorporated and registered. Legal formalities completed and team formation finalized.
  • March 2026 – Production Begins: Plant commissioned and running at full capacity. 5 TPH production line operational, serving thermal power plants and industrial clients.
  • Future Vision: Planning to increase production capacity with additional production lines. Installing solar plant for self-electricity generation.
  • Future Vision: Establishing own baling operations for paddy straw collection to achieve cost-cutting in raw material procurement.

Environmental Impact

Every ton of biomass pellets we produce prevents approximately 1.8 tons of CO2 emissions compared to coal. We are committed to making Punjab cleaner and greener.

item.title: Manufacturing Cost Breakdown
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Manufacturing Cost Breakdown

Transparent per-kilogram cost analysis for non-torrefied biomass pellet production.

Total Costs

  • Manufacturing Cost: ₹5.70 per kg
  • Total with Overheads: ₹6.75 per kg

Core Manufacturing Costs

Breakdown of all direct costs involved in producing one kilogram of biomass pellets:

ComponentCost per kgDetails
Raw Material (Paddy Straw)₹2.40Base buying price ₹1.75/kg. Effective cost including moisture, loading, unloading, wastage, internal transport.
Electric Cost₹1.45125 kWh/ton @ ₹9.50/kWh. Major operational expense.
Maintenance & Spare Parts₹0.65Die, roller assembly, shell, bearing, hammer, sieves with misc. Regular replacement required.
Labour₹0.50Operators, helpers, supervisors, manager, security, cleaning. 2 shifts operation.
Bank Interest₹0.50Based on ₹10 Cr loan @ 10% p.a.
Mishappening / Contingency₹0.20Buffer for unforeseen issues and unexpected repairs.

Manufacturing Subtotal: ₹5.70/kg

Additional Operating Costs

ComponentCost per kgDetails
Transport to NTPC & Private₹0.75Load & unload charges under 200km (depends on distance)
Factory Overheads & Misc₹0.30Admin salaries, insurance, office expenses, food & water

Total Cost (Delivered): ₹6.75/kg

Cost Cutting Methods

  1. Self Baling – Reduce raw material costs
  2. Solar Project – Reduce electricity costs
  3. Own Transport – Reduce logistics costs
  4. Double Project Setup – Economy of scale
  5. Subsidy + Loan Optimization
  6. Round Bales Usage – Better efficiency

Want a Detailed Cost Analysis?

Contact us for a customized cost breakdown based on your specific requirements and location.

WhatsApp: +91 62806 10158

item.title: Plant Equipment & Machinery
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Plant Equipment & Machinery

World-class YULONG biomass pellet manufacturing equipment with complete automation.

Plant Overview

  • 19+ Equipment Units
  • 725 KW Connected Load
  • 2.6 T/hr Production Capacity
  • Brand: YULONG

Complete Equipment List

1. Infeed Belt Conveyor 1000 MM

Power: 5HP gear motor 3-phase TEFC, IE3/IE4. Motor & VFD: ABB / Siemens. Length: 10m, Belt thickness: 8mm. Use: Shredder input conveyor. Qty: 1

2. Double Shaft Shredder with Platform (Key Equipment)

Power: 75+60 HP. Brand: SHREDO (Customized). Use: Main shredding. Qty: 1

3-5. Belt Conveyors (800 MM)

Multiple conveyors for material flow between processing stages. Power: 3HP gear motors with ABB/Siemens VFDs.

6. Dryer Double Pass Flash 5 Ton (Key Equipment)

Blower Power: 40HP × 2. Rotary Valve (Airlock): 5 HP × 2. With cyclone, stand & wood-base furnace. Use: To reduce moisture. Qty: 1

7. Automatic Feeder with Stand

Watch Glass / Stone Separator with structure 3 ton. Brand: PROVEG. Includes screw, feeder belt motor, roller drive system, cutter roller drum assembly. Use: Controlled feeding and stone/metal removal. Qty: 1

9. Hammer Mill 75×150 (Key Equipment)

Power: 200+4 KW. Brand: YULONG. Fan blower: CM-10C-55KW. Hammers: 126 PCS. Sieves: 4 pcs (6-8mm holes). PLC ECP box & full accessories. Use: Grinding. Qty: 1

11. Hydraulic Bin & Double Silo with PLC ECP

Size: 5.8 × 1.3 × 1.3m (for 2 set XGJ560). Brand: YULONG. Integrated mixing facility for burnt oil (1%). Use: Material storage and feeding control. Qty: 1

12. Vertical Ring Die Pellet Mill XGJ560 (Key Equipment)

Power: 160+2.2+0.55+2.2+0.05 KW. Die: 6mm/8mm ring-die (stainless steel). Brand: YULONG. 2 sets auto-lubrication device. Cooling fan blower. Soft starter. Use: Compressing powdered biomass into high-density pellets. Qty: 2

15. Pulse Jet Filter 240 Bags

Elgi Compressor: 15HP with Air Tank. Blower: 40 HP collector for plant. Use: Plant dust removal. Qty: 1

18. Electrical Cabinet & Automation

PLC, HMI, VFD, MCC, Soft Starter. SCADA with interlocking. APFC panel. Machine-mounted sensors. Use: Control room automation. Qty: 1

19. Installation & Erection

Complete plant setup including spark detection & suppression system, explosion vents, dust control, fire safety, AI-controlled CCTV, piping, ducting, ladders, platforms, and earthing.

Ready to Set Up Your Pellet Plant?

Get complete consultation on equipment selection, plant layout, and installation support.

WhatsApp: +91 62806 10158

item.title: Compliance & Approvals Checklist
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Compliance & Approvals Checklist

Track all 70+ licenses and approvals required for your biomass pellet plant.

1. Company & Legal Registration

  • Registered Sale Deed
  • Land Mutation & Jamabandi (Revenue Record)
  • Company Registration - Pvt Ltd (Preferred for subsidy & tender eligibility)
  • GST Registration
  • Udyam Registration for MSME
  • Trademark Registration
  • PAN & TAN for Company
  • Certificate of Incorporation
  • Memorandum & Articles of Association (MoA, AoA)
  • Board Resolution (authorized signatory)
  • Company DSC (Digital Signature Certificate)
  • D PIN
  • CIN/NIC Code
  • LEI (Legal Entity Identifier)

2. Land & Building Approvals

  • Grant Permission for Change of Land Use (CLU)
  • Building Plan Approval
  • NOC from Gram Panchayat / Local Body
  • Town & Country Planner (TCP) Approval
  • Site Plan Approval

3. Environmental & Pollution Control

  • Consent to Establish (CTE) – PPCB
  • Consent to Operate (CTO) – PPCB
  • Pollution Control Board & Green Category NOC
  • Water / Borewell connection / CGWA approval
  • Hazardous Waste Authorization (Ash, dust, lubricant waste)
  • Factory Effluent Treatment Plant (ETP) Approval
  • State Renewable Energy Dept. NOC

4. Factory & Industrial Licenses

  • Factory License (under Factories Act)
  • Shop & Establishment License
  • Provisional and Final Fire NOC
  • Boiler Registration (if using steam boilers)
  • PESO License (if storing diesel/fuel > 2500 liters)
  • District Industry Centre (DIC) Registration
  • Weighbridge Approval & Stamping

5. Electrical & Power

  • Electricity Load Approval (PSEB/PSPCL)
  • Certification of Electrical Infrastructure – CEIG
  • Charging Permission from CEIG
  • Transformer Installation Approval
  • Solar Installation NOC (if applicable)

6. Labour & Employment

  • Labour Department Registration
  • Labour Identification Number (LIN)
  • Registration for Migrant Workman
  • Contract Labour License / ESI Registration
  • Provident Fund Registration
  • Professional Tax Registration
  • Workmen Compensation Insurance

7. Quality & Certifications

  • ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Management)
  • ISO 14001 Certification (Environment)
  • ISO 45001 Certification (Safety)
  • BIS Certification for Pellets/Standards
  • Carbon Credit Monetization
  • REC Certificates
  • Pellet Test Reports (GCV, Moisture, Ash)

8. Transport & Logistics

  • Vehicle RC, Fitness Certificate
  • Vehicle Insurance
  • PUC Certificates
  • Driver's License
  • Goods Transport Agreement (if outsourced)

9. Insurance & Risk Management

  • Fire & Machinery Breakdown Insurance
  • Stock Insurance
  • Public Liability Insurance
  • Factory & Machinery Insurance

10. Business & Marketing

  • IEC Code (Import Export)
  • DPIIT Startup India Registration
  • NSIC Registration
  • GeM Portal Registration
  • IndiaMart / TradeIndia Listing
  • Google Maps / Just Dial Listing
  • Website & SEO Optimization
  • Demat Account

Important Notes

  • Requirements may vary based on your specific location and project scale
  • Some approvals are prerequisites for others (e.g., CTE before CTO)
  • Processing times vary from 1 week to 6 months depending on the approval

item.title: Potential Buyers & Customers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Potential Buyers & Customers

Large-scale consumers of biomass pellets across Punjab, Haryana & North India.

Thermal Power Plants

Under government mandate, thermal power plants must use 5-7% biomass co-firing, creating massive demand for pellets.

Punjab

  • Ropar Thermal Power Plant, Rupnagar – 1260 MW
  • Lehra Mohabbat Thermal Plant, Bhucho – 1980 MW

Haryana

  • Panipat Thermal Power Station – 1360 MW

NTPC & Others

Major Brands & Companies

  • ITC Limited – Agri-business division
  • Trident Group – Barnala, Punjab
  • Uttam Energy Limited – Renewable energy

  • Sukhbir Agro Energy Ltd – Punjab

Local Industry Contacts

  • Paper Factory – Near Tapa Grid

item.title: Biomass Pellets: Complete Guide for Industries in Punjab
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Punjab's industrial sector burns through thousands of crores worth of coal and fossil fuels annually. Meanwhile, 20+ million tons of paddy straw gets burned in fields, creating Delhi's infamous smog. Biomass pellets solve both problems—offering industries a cheaper, cleaner fuel while converting agricultural waste into profit.

This guide covers everything Punjab industries need to know: specifications, pricing, suppliers, and the exact steps to switch from coal to biomass pellets.

What Are Biomass Pellets?

Biomass pellets are compressed cylinders of organic material—agricultural waste, wood residue, or industrial byproducts—processed into a standardized, high-energy fuel. For Punjab industries, they represent a locally-sourced alternative to imported coal and expensive fossil fuels.

Key Advantages for Punjab Industries:

  • Cost savings of 20-40% compared to coal and LPG
  • Locally sourced from Punjab's agricultural waste
  • Carbon-neutral operation for ESG compliance
  • Consistent energy output with standardized specifications
  • Government incentives and carbon credit eligibility

Biomass Pellet Specifications

Quality specifications matter for efficient combustion and equipment longevity.

ParameterStandard ValueWhy It Matters
Diameter6-8 mmEnsures consistent feeding in boilers
Length10-40 mmPrevents jamming in feed systems
Moisture<10%Higher moisture reduces calorific value
Calorific Value4,000-4,500 Kcal/kgDetermines energy output per kg
Ash Content<5%Lower ash means less cleaning/maintenance
Bulk Density650-700 kg/m³Affects storage and transport costs
Sulphur<0.05%Critical for emission compliance

Types of Biomass Pellets & Pricing in Punjab

  • Agro-Waste Pellets: Rs 6,500-7,500/ton | 3,800-4,200 Kcal/kg | Ideal for brick kilns, small boilers
  • Wood Pellets: Rs 7,500-8,500/ton | 4,200-4,500 Kcal/kg | Ideal for textile mills, food processing
  • Mixed Biomass Pellets: Rs 7,000-8,000/ton | 4,000-4,300 Kcal/kg | General industrial heating
  • Premium Industrial Pellets: Rs 8,500-10,000/ton | 4,400-4,800 Kcal/kg | Co-firing power plants

How to Switch from Coal to Biomass Pellets

  1. Assess Your Current Setup – Evaluate boiler type, fuel consumption, and storage facilities
  2. Calculate Your Requirements – Plan for approximately 12 tons of pellets per 10 tons of coal
  3. Modify Feed Systems – Cost: Rs 50,000-2,00,000 depending on boiler capacity
  4. Arrange Storage – Covered shed or silo system for dry conditions
  5. Trial Run – Start with 10-20 ton trial order before full-scale adoption

Quality Warning

Cheap, low-quality pellets with high moisture or ash content will clog your equipment, reduce efficiency, and increase maintenance costs. Always verify specifications and choose certified manufacturers like Shree Balaji Envirotech LLP.

Delivery Across Punjab & North India

Shree Balaji Envirotech LLP delivers biomass pellets across Punjab and North India from our manufacturing facility in Bathinda. Regular supply routes include: Bathinda, Ludhiana, Jalandhar, Amritsar, Patiala, Mohali, Chandigarh, Ambala, Panipat, Karnal.

Get Started with Biomass Pellets Today

Contact Shree Balaji Envirotech LLP for a free consultation and competitive pricing.

Call: +91 83604 10158 | Email: shreebalajienvirotech@gmail.com

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the price of biomass pellets in Punjab?

Biomass pellet prices in Punjab range from Rs 6,500-10,000 per ton depending on the type. Contact Shree Balaji Envirotech in Bathinda for current bulk pricing.

Can I use biomass pellets in my existing coal boiler?

Yes, most coal boilers can be converted with minor modifications costing Rs 50,000-2,00,000.

What calorific value do biomass pellets offer?

Quality biomass pellets offer 3,800-4,800 Kcal/kg depending on type.

Where can I buy biomass pellets near Bathinda?

Shree Balaji Envirotech is a leading manufacturer in Bathinda. Call +91 83604 10158.

Are biomass pellets eligible for carbon credits?

Yes, each ton of biomass pellets used instead of coal prevents approximately 1.8 tons of CO2 emissions.

item.title: Stubble Burning in Punjab: How Biomass Pellets Solve the Crisis
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The Crisis: 20 Million Tons of Paddy Straw Burned Annually. Every October-November, Punjab's skies turn toxic. Farmers burn paddy straw (parali) because there's no profitable alternative. AQI levels exceed 500. Schools close. Health emergencies spike.

But there is a solution. The same paddy straw that creates pollution when burned becomes a valuable industrial fuel when converted to biomass pellets. Punjab's "waste" is actually worth Rs 3,000+ crore as renewable energy.

The Scale of Punjab's Stubble Problem

  • 20M+ tons of straw burned yearly
  • 15-day average burning window
  • Rs 2,500/acre cost for non-burn disposal
  • 30M tons CO2 emissions from burning

Why Do Farmers Burn Stubble?

  1. Tight sowing window: Only 15-20 days between rice harvest and wheat sowing
  2. Cost of alternatives: Mulching costs Rs 2,000-3,000 per acre
  3. No buyers for straw: Without accessible buyers, straw has no value
  4. Equipment unavailability: Happy Seeders and balers are scarce

The Solution: Biomass Pellet Production

Convert parali to profit. Biomass pellet plants buy paddy straw from farmers, process it into standardized fuel pellets, and sell to industries as a coal replacement.

For Farmers

  • Earn Rs 1,500-2,500/ton for straw
  • Free field clearing in many cases
  • No fines for burning
  • Additional Rs 5,000-10,000 per acre

For Industries

  • 20-40% cheaper than coal
  • Carbon credit eligibility
  • ESG compliance
  • Reliable local supply

For Environment

  • Zero field burning
  • Carbon-neutral energy
  • 30M tons CO2 reduction potential
  • Clean air for North India

The Economics: Making Stubble Profitable

ItemAmount per tonBeneficiary
Farmer receives for strawRs 1,500-2,500Farmer
Collection & transportRs 800-1,200Local transporters
Processing to pelletsRs 1,500-2,000Pellet manufacturer
Pellet selling priceRs 6,500-8,500Industry fuel cost
Industry savings vs coalRs 1,500-3,000End user

How It Works: From Field to Factory

  1. Straw Collection: Baling machines collect straw immediately after harvest
  2. Transport to Facility: Shree Balaji Envirotech in Bathinda has dedicated logistics
  3. Processing & Pelletization: Straw is shredded, dried, and compressed into 6-8mm pellets
  4. Quality Testing: Each batch tested for calorific value, moisture, and ash content
  5. Delivery to Industries: Finished pellets delivered to factories across Punjab and North India

Government Incentives

For Farmers

  • 80% subsidy on straw management equipment
  • Free baler rentals through cooperatives
  • Bonus payments for non-burning districts

For Industries

  • 5% GST on biomass vs 18% on coal
  • Accelerated depreciation on equipment
  • Carbon credit eligibility
  • State pollution board incentives

Growing Adoption Across Punjab

  • 50,000+ tons processed yearly
  • 200+ partner farmers
  • Rs 5 Cr+ annual farmer earnings

Join the Solution

Whether you're a farmer looking to sell straw or an industry seeking cleaner fuel, Shree Balaji Envirotech connects both sides of the solution.

Call: +91 83604 10158

FAQ

How much can farmers earn from selling paddy straw?

Farmers can earn Rs 1,500-2,500 per ton, translating to Rs 4,500-10,000 additional income per acre.

What government subsidies are available?

Up to 80% subsidy for individual farmers and 50% for cooperatives on straw management equipment under the Crop Residue Management scheme.

item.title: Switch from Coal to Biomass Pellets: Complete Industrial Guide
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Coal prices have increased 40% in the last three years. Emission regulations are tightening. ESG requirements are becoming mandatory. For Punjab industries, the question isn't whether to switch from coal—it's how quickly you can do it profitably.

Why Industries Are Switching to Biomass

The Coal Problem

  • Prices increased 40% since 2021
  • Import dependency and supply uncertainty
  • 20-40% ash content requiring frequent cleaning
  • Tightening emission norms and penalties
  • Negative ESG perception

The Biomass Solution

  • 20-40% cost savings vs coal
  • Locally sourced—no import dependency
  • Only 3-5% ash content
  • Carbon-neutral for emission compliance
  • Positive ESG rating impact

Cost Comparison: Coal vs Biomass Pellets

ParameterCoalBiomass PelletsAdvantage
Price per tonRs 10,000-12,000Rs 6,500-8,500Pellets: 25-35% cheaper
Cost per Million KcalRs 2,000-2,400Rs 1,500-1,900Pellets: 20-25% cheaper
Ash Content20-40%3-5%Pellets: 80% less ash
Sulphur Content2-4%<0.05%Pellets: Near zero
CO2 EmissionsHigh (fossil)Net zero (biogenic)Pellets: Carbon neutral

Quick Math: An industry consuming 100 tons of coal monthly at Rs 10,000/ton = Rs 10 lakhs. Switching to pellets (~115 tons needed) = Rs 8.6 lakhs. Monthly savings: Rs 1.4 lakhs.

Boiler Compatibility

  • Traveling Grate Boilers: Excellent compatibility – Rs 50,000-1,00,000 conversion
  • Chain Grate Boilers: Very Good – Rs 75,000-1,50,000 conversion
  • Stoker Boilers: Good – Rs 1,00,000-2,00,000 conversion
  • Fluidized Bed Boilers: Excellent – Rs 50,000-1,00,000 conversion
  • Fixed Grate Boilers: Moderate – Rs 2,00,000-5,00,000 conversion

Step-by-Step Conversion Process

  1. Site Assessment (1-2 days): Evaluate existing boiler, fuel consumption, storage facilities
  2. ROI Analysis (1-2 days): Detailed cost-benefit comparing coal vs pellet costs
  3. Equipment Modification (3-7 days): Feed system adjustments, air flow optimization
  4. Trial Run (2-3 days): Initial operation monitoring combustion efficiency
  5. Full-Scale Operation: Transition to regular pellet supply
  6. Performance Monitoring (3 months): Ongoing support and efficiency tracking

Technical Considerations

  • Air-to-Fuel Ratio: Typically 1.3-1.5:1 excess air for complete combustion
  • Feed Rate Calibration: Screw feeders need recalibration for pellet density
  • Combustion Zone Temperature: Maintain 850-950°C
  • Ash Handling: Much less ash than coal, existing systems usually work
  • Storage Requirements: Keep dry, minimum 2-week buffer stock
  • Emission Compliance: Biomass typically meets all norms without additional controls

Common Conversion Mistakes to Avoid

  • Using low-quality pellets with high moisture/ash
  • Ignoring storage—wet pellets disintegrate
  • Using coal air settings for biomass
  • Undersized supply contracts causing fuel shortage

Ready to Reduce Fuel Costs?

Get a free site assessment and ROI analysis. Call: +91 83604 10158

FAQ

How much does boiler conversion cost?

Rs 50,000 to Rs 5 lakhs depending on boiler type. ROI typically within 6-12 months.

Will switching reduce boiler efficiency?

Properly configured biomass systems achieve 80-85% efficiency, comparable to coal.

How much coal does 1 ton of pellets replace?

Approximately 0.85-0.9 tons of coal.

item.title: Biomass Pellet Prices in Punjab 2025: Complete Market Analysis
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Quick Price Reference: Punjab Market (Updated January 2025)

  • Agro-Waste Pellets: Rs 6,500-7,500/ton (Stable)
  • Wood Pellets: Rs 7,500-8,500/ton (Stable)
  • Mixed Biomass: Rs 7,000-8,000/ton (Decreasing)
  • Premium Industrial: Rs 8,500-10,000/ton (Slight increase)

Prices are per metric ton, ex-factory Bathinda. Transport additional based on distance.

Biomass pellet prices in Punjab remain competitive against coal in 2025, with most varieties offering 20-35% cost savings per unit of energy.

Detailed Price Breakdown by Type

Agro-Waste Pellets: Rs 6,500-7,500/ton

Materials: Rice husk, wheat straw, paddy straw, corn cobs. Calorific Value: 3,800-4,200 Kcal/kg. Best For: Brick kilns, small-medium boilers. Most economical option. Price drops post-harvest season.

Wood Pellets: Rs 7,500-8,500/ton

Materials: Sawdust, wood chips, furniture factory waste. Calorific Value: 4,200-4,500 Kcal/kg. Best For: Textile mills, food processing, pharmaceutical. Higher energy density justifies premium.

Mixed Biomass Pellets: Rs 7,000-8,000/ton

Materials: Combination of agricultural and wood waste. Calorific Value: 4,000-4,300 Kcal/kg. Good balance of price and performance. Most popular choice.

Premium Industrial Pellets: Rs 8,500-10,000/ton

Materials: Selected high-grade feedstock. Calorific Value: 4,400-4,800 Kcal/kg. Meets international standards. Lowest ash content.

Factors Affecting Prices

  • Seasonal Availability (High Impact): Post-harvest (Oct-Jan) lowest prices, Monsoon (Jul-Sep) highest
  • Raw Material Costs (High Impact): Paddy straw Rs 1,500-2,500/ton, wood waste Rs 2,000-3,000/ton
  • Transport Distance (Medium): Rs 500-1,500/ton beyond 100km from Bathinda
  • Order Volume (Medium): 50+ ton orders get 5-10% discount
  • Quality Specifications (Medium): Lower moisture, higher calorific value command premium

Regional Price Variations

CityAgro-WasteWood PelletsNotes
Bathinda (Hub)Rs 6,500-7,200Rs 7,500-8,200Ex-factory, lowest in Punjab
LudhianaRs 7,000-7,700Rs 8,000-8,700High industrial demand
JalandharRs 7,200-7,900Rs 8,200-8,900Growing market
AmritsarRs 7,300-8,000Rs 8,300-9,000Good availability
Patiala/MohaliRs 7,000-7,700Rs 8,000-8,700Close to Bathinda
ChandigarhRs 7,500-8,200Rs 8,500-9,200Premium market

2025 Price Forecast: Stable to Declining

  • Q1 (Jan-Mar): Lowest prices, ideal for bulk purchases
  • Q2 (Apr-Jun): Slight increase as raw material depletes
  • Q3 (Jul-Sep): Peak prices during monsoon
  • Q4 (Oct-Dec): Prices drop with new harvest

Tips for Best Prices

  1. Buy in bulk (50+ tons) for 5-10% discounts
  2. Sign annual contracts for price stability
  3. Purchase post-harvest (Nov-Jan) for lowest rates
  4. Choose manufacturers near your location
  5. Verify quality specs to avoid hidden costs

Contact Shree Balaji Envirotech for current quotes: +91 83604 10158

item.title: Rice Husk Pellets: Benefits, Manufacturing & Applications
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Punjab processes over 12 million tons of paddy annually, generating millions of tons of rice husk as a byproduct. Once considered waste, rice husk is now a valuable raw material for biomass pellet production.

What Are Rice Husk Pellets?

Rice husk pellets are compressed cylinders made from the outer covering of rice grains, removed during milling. Dried, ground, and compressed into uniform 6-8mm pellets suitable for industrial combustion.

SpecificationValueNotes
Diameter6-8 mmStandard industrial size
Calorific Value3,800-4,200 Kcal/kgVaries with processing
Moisture Content<10%Critical for efficiency
Ash Content8-15%Higher than wood pellets
Bulk Density600-650 kg/m³Good for storage
Silica Content15-20%Characteristic of rice husk

Benefits of Rice Husk Pellets

Cost-Effective

  • Lowest cost among biomass pellets
  • 30-40% cheaper than coal on energy basis
  • Abundant raw material in Punjab

Environmentally Friendly

  • Carbon-neutral combustion
  • Reduces rice mill waste burden
  • Lower emissions than fossil fuels

Manufacturing Process

  1. Collection & Storage: Fresh rice husk from mills, stored dry
  2. Drying: To <12% moisture using rotary dryers
  3. Grinding: Uniform 2-4mm particle size via hammer mills
  4. Conditioning: Steam/water to activate natural lignin binder
  5. Pelletization: High pressure (100-200 bar) through die holes
  6. Cooling: Counter-flow cooler to harden and stabilize
  7. Screening & Packing: Moisture-resistant 50kg bags or bulk silos

Industrial Applications

  • Brick Kilns: Excellent – cost-effective, handles higher ash
  • Rice Mills: Excellent – uses own waste, self-sufficient energy
  • Textile Mills: Good – check ash handling capacity
  • Distilleries: Excellent – steam boilers, cost reduction
  • Power Generation: Good – co-firing, biomass plants

Rice Husk vs Wood Pellets Comparison

ParameterRice HuskWood Pellets
Price per tonRs 6,500-7,500Rs 7,500-8,500
Calorific Value3,800-4,200 Kcal/kg4,200-4,500 Kcal/kg
Ash Content8-15%3-5%
Availability in PunjabHighMedium

Rice Husk Availability in Punjab

  • 12M+ tons paddy processed/year
  • 2.5M+ tons rice husk generated
  • 2,000+ rice mills in Punjab

Contact Shree Balaji Envirotech: +91 83604 10158

item.title: Textile Mills Punjab: Cut Fuel Costs 40% with Biomass Pellets
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Textile Mills in Punjab: Is Expensive Fuel Shrinking Your Margins?

How rising coal and diesel prices are hitting Punjab's textile industry—and the local biomass solution saving mills 25-40%.

The Fuel Crisis Hitting Punjab Textile Mills

  • Coal prices at Rs 11,000-13,000/ton—up 45% in 3 years
  • Diesel generators costing Rs 95+/litre during power cuts
  • Dyeing and finishing operations consuming 60-70% of energy costs
  • Pollution board scrutiny increasing on coal-fired boilers
  • Export orders demanding carbon footprint documentation

Punjab's Textile Industry: The Fuel Challenge

Punjab's textile belt—spanning Ludhiana, Jalandhar, Amritsar, and Bathinda—houses over 3,000 textile mills employing lakhs of workers. These mills run steam boilers 16-20 hours daily for dyeing (120-140°C), finishing & calendering, and drying systems.

With fuel comprising 30-40% of production costs, every rupee saved on fuel directly improves margins.

Biomass Pellets for Textile Mills

Biomass Pellets: Rs 7,000-8,500/ton vs Coal: Rs 11,000-13,000/ton

A textile mill consuming 100 tons monthly saves Rs 3-5 lakhs/month—Rs 36-60 lakhs annually.

  • Consistent Heat: 3800-4200 kcal/kg, ideal for dyeing temperature control
  • Boiler Compatible: Works with existing Lancashire & FBC boilers
  • Low Ash: 3-5% ash content means less cleaning, more uptime
  • Stable Pricing: Locally sourced, insulated from global fuel volatility

Case Study: Medium-Sized Dyeing Unit, Ludhiana

  • Rs 4.2L monthly fuel savings
  • 45 days conversion ROI payback
  • 100% pollution compliance

FAQ

How much can textile mills save with biomass pellets?

Typically 25-40%. A mill spending Rs 15 lakhs monthly on coal can reduce costs to Rs 9-11 lakhs.

Are biomass pellets suitable for textile dyeing boilers?

Yes. They provide consistent high heat (3800-4200 kcal/kg) ideal for dyeing processes.

Contact: +91 83604 10158 | WhatsApp
